content:
BaseOcxArray Class

In this Article

Provides a control array of ActiveX controls.

Syntax

Declaration

[System.Obsolete("Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.* classes are obsolete and supported within 32 bit processes only. http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=160862")]
public abstract class BaseOcxArray : Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.BaseControlArray

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • MarshalByRefObject
  • Component
  • Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.BaseControlArray
  • BaseOcxArray

Remarks

The BaseOCXArray class provides an equivalent for the run-time functionality of a Visual Basic 6.0 ActiveX control array. It does not provide the design-time features of a Visual Basic 6.0 control array.

Note

Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

Events summary

CausesValidationChanged

Occurs when the value of the stem.Windows.Forms.Control.CausesValidation* property changes.

Occurs when the value of the stem.Windows.Forms.Control.ClientSize* property changes.

Occurs when the value of the stem.Windows.Forms.Control.ContextMenu* property changes.
ContextMenuStripChanged

Occurs when the value of the stem.Windows.Forms.Control.ContextMenuStrip* property changes.
ControlAdded

Occurs when a new control is added to the BaseOcxArray.
ControlRemoved

Occurs when a control is removed from the BaseOcxArray.
DockChanged

Occurs when the value of the stem.Windows.Forms.Control.Dock* property changes.
Enter

Occurs when the control is entered.
Leave

Occurs when the input focus leaves the control.
LocationChanged

Occurs when the value of the stem.Windows.Forms.Control.Location* property changes.
MarginChanged

Occurs when the value of the stem.Windows.Forms.Control.Margin* property changes.
MouseCaptureChanged

Occurs when the control loses or gains mouse capture.
Move

Occurs when the control is moved.
PaddingChanged

Occurs when the control's stem.Windows.Forms.Control.Padding* property changes.
ParentChanged

Occurs when the control's stem.Windows.Forms.Control.Parent* property changes.
RegionChanged

Occurs when the value of the stem.Windows.Forms.Control.Region* property changes.
Resize

Occurs when the control is resized.
SizeChanged

Occurs when the stem.Windows.Forms.Control.Size* property value changes.
SystemColorsChanged

Occurs when the system colors change.
Validated

Occurs when the control is finished validating.
Validating

Occurs when the control is validating.
VisibleChanged

Occurs when the stem.Windows.Forms.Control.Visible* property value changes.

Constructors

  • BaseOcxArray()

    Initializes a new instance of the BaseOCXArray class.

    protected BaseOcxArray ();

    Remarks

    When you instantiate a BaseOCXArray, you must also call the BaseSetIndex method to create the initial element in the array.

    Note

    Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

    Initializes a new instance of the BaseOCXArray class, specifying its container.

    Parameters

      The IContainer where the control array will be hosted.

    Remarks

    When you instantiate a BaseOCXArray, you must also call the BaseSetIndex method to create the initial element in the array.

  • HookUpControlEvents(Object)

    Overrides crosoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.BaseControlArray.HookUpControlEvents*.

    protected override void HookUpControlEvents (object o);

    Parameters

    • o
      Object

      An Object.

    Remarks

    This method cannot be called from your application's code. Use AddHandler to hook up events for any controls that are added by using the Load method.

    Note

    Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

  • Leave

    Occurs when the input focus leaves the control.

    public event EventHandler Leave;

    Remarks

    When you change the focus by using the keyboard (TAB, SHIFT+TAB, and so on), or by calling the Select or SelectNextControl method, focus events occur in the following order:

    Enter GotFocus

    Leave

    LostFocus

    When you change the focus by using the mouse or by calling the Focus method, focus events occur in the following order:

    Enter GotFocus LostFocus

    Leave

    For more information about how to handle events, see Events.

    Note

    Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

  • MouseCaptureChanged

    Occurs when the control loses or gains mouse capture.

    public event EventHandler MouseCaptureChanged;

    Remarks

    Clicking a mouse button when the pointer is over a shape typically raises the following series of events from the control:

    MouseDown

    Click

    MouseClick

    MouseUp

    Two clicks that occur close enough in time, as determined by the mouse settings of the user's operating system, will generate an MouseDoubleClick event instead of the second MouseClick event.

    Note

    Click events are logically higher-level events of a control. They are often raised by other actions, such as pressing the ENTER key when the control has focus.

    For more information about how to handle events, see Events.

    Note

    Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

    Occurs when the control is moved.

They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

  • Resize

    Occurs when the control is resized.

    public event EventHandler Resize;

    Remarks

    To determine the Size of the resized control, you can cast the sender parameter of the EventArgs data to a Control and get its Size property (or Height and Width properties individually).

    To handle custom layouts, use the Layout event instead of the Resize event. The Layout event is raised in response to a Resize event, but also in response to other changes that affect the layout of the control.

    For more information about how to handle events, see Events.

    Note

    Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework.     Occurs when the system colors change.

    public event EventHandler SystemColorsChanged;

    Remarks

    This event is raised if the SystemColors is changed by either a programmatic modification or user interaction.

    For more information about how to handle events, see Events.

    Note

    Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

  • Validated

    Occurs when the control is finished validating.

    public event EventHandler Validated;

    Remarks

    When you change the focus by using the keyboard (TAB, SHIFT+TAB, and so on), by calling the Select or SelectNextControl methods, or by setting the ActiveControl property to the current form, focus events occur in the following order:

    Enter GotFocus Leave Validating

    Validated

    LostFocus

    When you change the focus by using the mouse or by calling the Focus method, focus events occur in the following order:

    Enter GotFocus LostFocus Leave Validating

    Validated

    If the CausesValidation property is set to false, the Validating and Validated events are suppressed.

    If the Cancel property of the CancelEventArgs is set to true in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.BaseOCXArray.Validating> event delegate, all events that would usually occur after the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.BaseOCXArray.Validating> event are suppressed.

    For more information about how to handle events, see Events.

    Note

    Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

  • Validating

    Occurs when the control is validating.

    public event System.ComponentModel.CancelEventHandler Validating;

    Remarks

    When you change the focus by using the keyboard (TAB, SHIFT+TAB, and so on), by calling the Select or SelectNextControl methods, or by setting the ActiveControl property to the current form, focus events occur in the following order:

    Enter GotFocus Leave

    Validating

    Validated LostFocus

    When you change the focus by using the mouse or by calling the Focus method, focus events occur in the following order:

    <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.BaseOCXArray.Enter> GotFocus LostFocus Leave

    Validating

    Validated

    If the CausesValidation property is set to false, the Validating and Validated events are suppressed.

    If the Cancel property of the CancelEventArgs is set to true in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.BaseOCXArray.Validating> event delegate, all events that would usually occur after the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.BaseOCXArray.Validating> event are suppressed.

    For more information about how to handle events, see Events.

    Note

    Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

    Occurs when the stem.Windows.Forms.Control.Visible* property value changes.
